intro: Stachytarpheta straminea, commonly known as the golden bristleplant, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as coastal areas and open woodlands. It produces small, bristly fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Stachytarpheta straminea is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
